intro: Thrixspermum ponapense, commonly known as the Ponape hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thrixspermum ponapense is often found in coastal areas and thrives in humid, tropical climates.
